sen.e: Ryutaro MAZUME (1844 - ?) was a Shinsengumi member, who was said to have come from Chugoku region.

sen.j: 美男で女好きだったが気が弱く、仲間の隊士達と飲みに行くこともできなかった。
sen.e: He was handsome and ladies' man but so timid that he could not go out for a drink with other members.

sen.e: Instead, he was on good terms with a baby-sitter (a dark-skinned, short-statured and curly-headed ugly woman) hired by Kamejiro NANBU, who was a goshi (country samurai) of Mibu village.

sen.e: The father and the son of MAZUME family began to feel out of place and got loose from Shinsengumi at one of these nights.

sen.j: 父・新太郎は45,6歳で、号を柳元斎と称して書が上手い一方、刀の差し方などまるで知らず、隊士達によく使いっぱしりをさせられていたらしい。
sen.e: It is said that the father, Shintaro, 45 or 46 years old, was an excellent calligrapher known under the name of Ryugensai, but he did not even know how to wear a sword at all, which often made him run errands for other members.
